pullRequest.body:
Provides a constructor lemmas for functors `Grothendieck F ⥤ E` as well as the of fibers of `F` into `Grothendieck F`.

Also improves the simp behaviour for the identity morphism on the Grothendieck construction.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [a7a81a1d7d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18258/commits/a7a81a1d7d862480cbded9b68254f255c0a6ec64)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ faithful_ι`
`+ functorFrom`
`+ id_base`
`+ id_fiber`
`+ ι`
`+ ιCompFunctorFrom`
`- id_fiber'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Suggestions for the names as well as for a better packaging of the arguments to the constructor are very welcome :grin: 

Also, should `apply` be named differently and put into the `CategoryTheory.Functor` namespace in order to enable the dot notation for the partial application?

:v: javra can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11631276814/job/32391989306)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11631276814/job/32391989632)

Would not it be more simple to define the "inclusion of fibers" functor `F.obj c ⥤ Grothendieck F`, which would make this "apply" unnecessary, because this would just be the precomposition with `H`. (Already, the definition of the `obj` and `map` fields formally looks like the composition of two functors.)
Ah, thanks for the suggestion, I completely mised this.
This docstring seems to be outdated.
We generally try to avoid non-definitional equality of functors. Is this equality unavoidably necessary in your application or would a natural isomorphism suffice?

That's why I didn't make it a simp lemma. My gut feeling is that we'll need the equality but maybe it's also enough if it just reduces on objects, which it does... Maybe I'll just add the iso for now and add an equality option if we really need it later.
I think the name `ιCompFunctorFrom` more closely matches our usual naming for these things.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Grothendieck): Functors from the Grothendieck construction
